page.title: 06Waggoners Wells
page.content: neighbouring land is used by the {Ministry of Defence}for Army manoeuvres. During the last war some of the land close to Waggoners Wells was occupied by various military establishments including a depot and training camp for the{Queen {Alexandra's Royal Army Nursing Corps} on the adjacent{Bramshott Common.}To the south of the A3 was the{Connaught} {Hospital,}(Army Chest Centre), but little remains apart from the road layout and the evidence on contemporary maps. Going back even further in time reveals the origin of the lakes. Iron was found in the local sands and lead to the establishment of iron workings in the 17th century. The name of the iron-master was{Wakener}and in order to provide water power for the forge- bellows, he constructed a chain of
